Implementing a National Technology Strategy with Self-Organizing Industry Investment Boards,” Brookings Papers, Microeconomics 2. This quote from Paul Romer aptly summarizes his view, developed in the Eighties and now widely held, that economic growth is attributable at least in part to advances in knowledge and technological breakthroughs

Romer emphasizes the necessity of technological advancement over shifts, however necessary, in macroeconomic policy measures. I think he is trying to make the point that policy modif ications at the margins of economic activity are second order to the central role played by industrial and technological innovation in the advancement of economic growth
